title: Bug 21706: BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706: BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage. The purpose of this bug report is to add a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. Currently, there are no non-static methods in this class, so it would be a good idea to prevent people from instantiating the class if there's no need to. This will not increase the size, as the compiler already provides a free public constructor. Instead, the goal is to make the constructor private instead of public.
OB: The BidiUtil class in win32 does not have a private constructor.
EB: The BidiUtil class in win32 should have a private constructor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the BidiUtil class in win32. 
2. Check if a private constructor is present. 
3. If not, manually add a private constructor to the class. 
4. Save and compile the class. 
5. Verify that the BidiUtil class now has a private constructor.
